author: checknft.io
title: Bring Ethereum NFT users to Cardano
description: CNFTs are popular only inside Ada community because ETH users dont have connections with Cardano NFTs. No tools for side-by-side comparison.

f6_assessments.q0: After reading the proposal I'm not a 100% sure what problem it solves, but I think the authros want to create a platform for analyzing NFTs (value, relative price and more) and something about ETH users that I didn't quite understand. If the proposers want to do a tool for NFT analytics, they're in the correct challenge setting. IMHO the proposers could have done a better job articulating the actual problem they're trying so solve so I could have estimated the value that could bring to the ecosystem. There are relevant key metrics mentioned in the project, which I'll touch on later.  It would be a good idea to add a few more lines explaining the proposal and the problem it solves along with the impact for the community if successful. I'm really interested to understand the economic incentive ETH users would have to use the application, because that part was unclear. As a developer I'm worried about clear implementation strategy.
f6_assessments.q1: There are links in the proposal, which allowed me to verify Vasiliy Karpitski and hiss credentials, but the other linked in link wasn't working I think it was not completed. My suggestion for future proposals would be to read through the whole proposal as a voter for your proposal and look through all the left links to be sure they work before finalizing a proposal. The budget is outlined, but I was missing the exact calculation leading the the requested budget. As a developer myself, the timetable seems realistic, anad it's cool that the proposers are ready to self fund any additional costs themselves, which is noteworthy. There's a sensible plan for implementation and some technologies like graphql are mentioned, which I believe considering the properties of the project is the right call. The plan for implementation could have been a bit more specific, but as it is now it's good enough as well. The proposal doesn't go into too much detail into the technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies for the implementation which is a bit disapointing for me as a developer, but since they want to keep the intelectual property of their project I guess it's fair. The proposers have mentioned some potentiall challenges and how they plan on solving them.  Overall I think the proposal is doable, but lack of credentials brings the whole credability of the proposal a bit down. The idea for the community to try the MVP before proposal voting and provide feedback is great, but I didn't see mentioned how would this feedback be provided.
f6_assessments.q2: I did open the https://checknft.io/, but unfortunately I didn't see anywhere a community member could get an update for the progress of the project, neither a facebook group discord or telegram was mentioned. Usually projects need to find a way to let the community and interested investors a communication channel, but I didn't find such in the proposal. This leads me to believe that communicating the progress of the proposal might be difficult, which would lead to difficulties in auditability. The mentioned KPIs and metrics seem relevant to the projects success and are a good definition of success. A roadmap with concrete milestones are available and put in a nice timeframe for execution. As I mentioned earlier the project description could have been better, because after reading the whole thing twice I still wasn't sure about all the problems the proposer believes he addresses.  I'd suggest for the proposers to put themselves in the shoes of the voters.  As a voter I want a link to a communication channel that I could get the feedback to you, which is missed in the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The availability of an online NFTs comparison platform with an aim to bring out the best in market dynamics may have a substantial cascading effect with the potential to educate the people on the sophistication of Cardano outside the Cardano community. This will also bring raise the adoption of Cardano substantially. Therefore this proposal is addressing an important challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: One of the proposers has experience of about five years as a business development manager. The proposal aims to build a web portal/app for preparing and presenting NFTs available in Cardano and Etherium ecosystem to bring out the value. This proposal has no major technical challenges and needs business acuman to complete. This I feel is available with the proposers. Therefore the proposal is likely to be implemented in a good manner.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has sufficient information to monitor the progress. It has a straightforward aim and technically simple activity which most probably can be carried out by many developers. The MVP is being made by the proposer funds and is likely to be available before voting this is likely to improve the audibility even further.

f6_assessments.q0:
While in principle efforts to bring over NFTcollectors from ETH to Cardano could be somewhat impactful it's doubtful that the proposed solution will result in that. The mere existence of a comparison tool will do little in the way of achieving that, if not coupled with a thoughtful and strong awareness campaign. Content will determine the outcomes of such endeavours, tools will only be nice additions. Even then it will be a very steep hill to climb due to the tribal nature of blockchain at the moment.
Also, the number of NFTs that the team has indicated they aim to process on their platform is very low considering the average NFT collection has 10.000 collectables and there are already countless collections on both ETH and Cardano, and their number will only increase as time goes by.
f6_assessments.q1: The website provided is basically just a landing page at the moment and no functionality is present. In and of itself this wouldn't necessarily constitute a problem, however, this is coupled with other shortcomings of the proposal. Apart from the links to LinkedIn profiles, very little info about the team is given, and one of those links is broken. No other links to relevant previous work are provided. On the other hand, the proposal seems to be sufficiently well written, so my assessment of the feasibility of this proposal is mixed.
f6_assessments.q2:
Metrics for audibility are present and clear. 
Given the roadmap and set launch date I see no problems in the community being able to verify the project if funded. The proposers mention that they will begin work prior to voting, allowing for progress to be checked by the community without risking more than possibly the initial allocation of funds.
f6_assessments.reply:
CA correctly says content itself determines the outcome, and tools will be nice. That is the point - when giving the 2 pieces of art or collectible to choose from, our service will help select the best one, and due to the efficiency of Cardano (POS), our tool will provide the side-by-side comparison, and the user will choose the best one. In his own words, CA is doubtful. Maybe he is not an expert in the Business Intelligence tools and crossover with NFTs. Regarding the Number provided in Key Success Indicators or success, metrics are the analysis by users (connected wallets). Our backend is indexing blockchain means we have a database with all the NFTs data available for analysis on-demand by users. Regarding the broken link to the profile, we have corrected one in the comments to the proposal and let me duplicate it here:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexei-dulub/

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal looks to implement a website that compares the NFT collections available in the market on Ethereum and if funded Cardano so that people can get information and analysis about those collections. Some key areas that they intend to look at are things such as sentiment analysis, visual info and performance data. 

From an informational and potentially investment standpoint NFT collectors could benefit from an effective tool for comparing different NFT collections in the Cardano ecosystem as well as other ecosystems. The proposer team has not mentioned any of the big marketplaces that provide data for users to explore such as https://opensea.io/assets/cryptopunks or https://rarible.com/top-collections or even other explorers such as https://nftbank.ai/explorer.

The question is does this suggested solution move the needle in the market and make an impactful solution? With the information provided, the lack of website or data analytics proving this solution does indeed have an impact it is hard to determine whether it is likely that this proposal has a high impact for the Cardano ecosystem. More information and analytics on a launch of this product would help to provide valuable evidence of whether this is indeed valuable or not - any subsequent proposal made with this information is welcomed!
f6_assessments.q1: The team is listed as two linked in profiles. One of the LinkedIn profiles does not work. The other profile for Vasiliy shows that he does not have a programming background. A roadmap into sections is broken down with a task itemised list. No Github profile is made available in the proposal and the current website provided is made using a website creator. Due to this there is no existing evidence that the team has or can execute the suggested solution they want to work on and there is not sufficient evidence that the team has the background and skills required to execute this proposal feasibly. We would welcome a re-submission of this proposal with this information in the future and the first version of the site to show evidence of feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap is provided with tasks in each one and a date range in which they will be completed. KPIs are provided about the number of analysed NFTs. It is hard to say that having a KPI for the number of analysed NFTs is a good KPI as if you analyse millions of NFTs but no user is consuming that information then that would still be a failed and non impactful project. It would be good to see more information on KPIs for certain user interactions that would help to gage whether their platform is useful. For instance it could be user time spent viewing collection NFT data or potentially how many NFTs a user bookmarks or some similar engagement metric. There is a lot of room for more impactful metrics to be mentioned.
f6_assessments.reply:
1. Our proposal is submitted to provide maximum impact with the slightest technical sophistication. Due to the focus on how our tool can allow Cardano NFTs to be exposed to Ethereum users, which will pull adoption, we didn't provide too many details on functionality and benefits for the CNFT community. Competitors provided by CA have different functionality and focus only on Ethereum. As Cardano long-time holders and delegators, we want to give great tools to analyze NFTs for the Cardano community and bring users from Ethereum. 

2. CA is correct that the link is not working, but it's not proving that team cannot deliver. However, we have a valid link in the comments. The valid link for the second co-founder 
https://www.linkedin.com/in/alexei-dulub/

3. It's my fault that I was not clear enough in stating the KPI's. Analysed NFTs means analyzed done by users. Also, its clearly stated users/interactions metrics: In 12 months - 1mln. Cardano NFTs analysis per month, 200 000 Cardano wallets connected, 100 000 Ethereum users per month (wallets connected) analyzing Cardano NFTs and clicking on Cardano Marketplaces from service. Our solution is to index the node (blockchain), which means all data is stored in our backend.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a great and brilliant idea outlined by the proposer. The proposal effectively addresses the challenge. This is a game changer and has the potential of bringing new and experienced users from Ethereum unto the cardano blockchain once we begin to see several integrations of this sort.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer and team have the desired knowledge and skill to execute the task. The proposer has provided relevant links that is enough to help assessors make an informed decision. The budget is on point but not detailed enough.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has in a place the key metrics, roadmap and a projection of how success will look like after the project is executed. This i think is great information that can help track the success and progress of the project when it is funded

f6_assessments.q0: This is an awesome proposal with a clear challenge statement that outlined an acute painpoint in the space. However, it might be good to provide elaboration for the rationale behind integrating with checkNFT.io in terms of why it would be beneficial for the Cardano ecosystem, how large of a benefit will it be, and why. There is definitely potential for this to scale so everything looks good except for the elaboration part (coming from someone who's not that familiar with the space as of yet)! As such, I would give this 4 star for impact.
f6_assessments.q1: There seem to be few technical components involved that might make it difficult for the idea to be actualized and even if there are, the proposal appears to be self-sustaining afterward with minimal input needed. The LinkedIn profiles attached do give people the sense that this project is in good hands, not to mention the connection with the co-founders of the platform. However, it's worth noting that one of the link to the LinkedIn profile (https://www.linkedin.com/in/dulub) is broken and it might be good for it to be fixed. Overall, the proposal is absolutely feasible and I can see it be implemented without much of a hiccup.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget estimate seems appropriate and is tagged to specific actions and objectives to be achieved. KPIs are available to measure the success of the proposal along each milestone, and a clear roadmap has been provided. Overall, there is no problem with the clarity of the proposal and thus I would give this 5 star for auditability.

solution: Cardano integration with checkNFT.io service. In a single tool, ETH users will analyse ETH NFTs with CNFTs that will pull adoption from ETH.
experience: 2 Co-Founders of checkNFT.io has 18+ years in IT R&D (6+ years of blockchain R&D), Sales and Business Development (ex-Microsoft, ex-Intel).
